fields.blog_title: Ethics Governing New Testament Church Life
fields.blog_body:
Interpretation of Tongues

Upon you this morning is an atmosphere of the spirit to bring things down. I am bringing things from your Shepherd to you, to bring things to you, to bring grace to you. For I am causing light to shine. I will cause you to see, I will cause grace to be dispensed to you, I will make your heart receive with the strength of grace that I will be releasing. Your heart will be able to turn to receive the light I am shining. Open your heart and receive, for I have things to tell you, I have things to bring down. Do not let the atmosphere just stay there, receive the atmosphere in you, receive that which has been brought down by your hunger, by your openness. Open up your heart, do not reject what I am saying, do not reject by counsel, rather open up your heart and you will find grace to turn.

 

 

Message Begins

There are ethics around the New Testament church and those ethics are to help the saints to receive the blessings that are for them. Those ethics help us to know how to behave because there is a way we ought to behave in the Church.

 

1 Timothy 3:15 KJV

(15) But if I tarry long, that thou mayest know how thou oughtest to behave thyself in the house of God, which is the church of the living God, the pillar and ground of the truth.

 

This scripture is not just referring to Timothy; he is not the only one that needs this instruction. There is a way folks ought to behave in church and there is a posture that the flocks need to take to be able to maximize the blessing for the shepherd.

                                                                     1 Peter 5:4 KJV

                           (4) And when the chief Shepherd shall appear, ye shall receive a crown of glory that fadeth not away.

 

 

 

Jesus is the Chief Shepherd but there are shepherds that He has put in place in the Church. Every other shepherd that the Lord ordains is under Him and there are things that the shepherds receive from Him.

 

Hebrews 13:20 KJV

(20) Now the God of peace, that brought again from the dead our Lord Jesus, that great shepherd of the sheep, through the blood of the everlasting covenant,

 

He is the great Shepherd of the sheep or the Chief Shepherd of this sheep. There are other shepherds that God commissioned under Him. We cannot have shepherds without flocks in view, shepherds are raised to attend to the flocks, if there are no flocks, there will be no need for shepherds.

                                                                         Ephesians 4:11 KJV

                    (11) And he gave some, apostles; and some, prophets; and some, evangelists; and some, pastors and teachers;

 

He gave the flocks shepherds as gifts. All these gifts are shepherds, they are shepherds in degree. Apostles shepherd churches, while pastors shepherd local assemblies, they relate with the flocks one on one. Daddy used to say that a grown up pastor is a standing apostle because he is overseeing the flock

 

Shepherds are needed in order to help souls journey back to God. Souls on their own cannot go back to God because they don't know the way.

 

1 Peter 2:25 KJV

(25) For ye were as sheep going astray; but are now returned unto the Shepherd and Bishop of your souls.

 

The reason this local church was put in place is so that you do not go astray. The word “going” in this scripture signifies that it is a present continuous term, we are going astray and it will require a journey to stop treading the path of going astray. As preaching is going on in this local assembly, people are still going astray. So, we all need shepherds to go back to God. You don't even have a sense of knowing how to go back without meeting a shepherd; if there are no shepherds, we will keep going astray until we can no longer be saved.

 

 

Immediately man fell in Genesis, there was a gap and the gap kept increasing. Adam left the garden but he was still around the garden; however, Cain journeyed far away from God. The reason shepherds are kept in place is because we have to go back to God. When I study the scriptures, I find something really interesting about shepherds.

 

I am zeroing down the context to pastors of the local assembly. If you don't have a pastor, you are going nowhere; in the real sense, you have not started your Christian journey at all. There is nothing like: I am a Christian but I don't have a pastor, if you believe that, you are confused.

 

The Lord Jesus who set them in the local assembly knows what He is doing. I pray that this message will make you see and make the necessary adjustment.

 

Psalms 80:1 KJV

  1. To the chief Musician upon Shoshannimeduth, A Psalm of Asaph. Give ear, O Shepherd of Israel, thou that leadest Joseph like a flock; thou that dwellest between the cherubims, shine

forth.

 

If you are not a flock, you will make work difficult for shepherds. What ought not to be hard becomes so difficult and hard. It is not that it is difficult in that sense, but you have taken a posture that makes it hard for you to be accessed by the shepherds. I now understand that all the friends of God in scriptures were shepherds; I believe that cannot be a coincidence. This is not to say that everyone should go get sheep and start rearing, but I understood that there is something about people that are around the sheep. There is a kind of heart they develop, I call it a shepherd's heart; it makes them close to God. Abel was a shepherd of the sheep and it did something to his heart such that he was enabled to do the will of God.

 

Genesis 4:2 KJV

  1. And she again bare his brother Abel. And Abel was a keeper of sheep, but Cain was a tiller of the ground.

 

There is something around this thing that makes these people keepers of the sheep. When you are not being shepherded as you ought to, you cannot please God in any way.

 

                                                                    1 Samuel 16:11 KJV

 

  1. And Samuel said unto Jesse, Are here all thy children? And he said, There remaineth yet the youngest, and, behold, hekeepeth the sheep. And Samuel said unto Jesse, Send and fetch him: for we will not sit down till he come hither.

 

 

Abraham was also a shepherd, he was a shepherd who dwelt in tents. Isaac was also a shepherd and he dwelt in tents. Jacob was a shepherd and that was his job; he also stayed in tents. When he went to Laban, that was what he was doing. All the twelve children of Israel were all shepherds, it was their occupation and God chose it for them.

 

Genesis 46:32-34 KJ

    1. And the men are shepherds, for their trade hath been to feed cattle; and they have brought their flocks, and their herds, and all that they have.

    1. And it shall come to pass, when Pharaoh shall call you, and shall say, What is your occupation?

    2. That ye shall say, Thy servants' trade hath been about cattle from our youth even until now, both we, and also our fathers: that ye may dwell in the land of Goshen; for every shepherd is an abomination unto the Egyptians.

 

There is something about the shepherdic ministry that is anti-the-world, for instance here, it was an abomination to the Egyptians to be a shepherd. When you like the world, you cannot like shepherds because they are meant to take you out of Egypt. One other amazing thing I found out was that Moses, who was not a shepherd, was sent to live with a shepherd (Jethro) for 40 years so he could learn how to tend God’s flock.

 

Exodus 2:15 KJV

(15) Now when Pharaoh heard this thing, he sought to slay Moses. But Moses fled from the face of Pharaoh, and dwelt in the land of Midian: and he sat down by a well.

 

Exodus 2:21 KJV

  1.  And Moses was content to dwell with the man: and he gave Moses Zipporah his daughter.

 

All the daughters of this man were shepherds.

 

Exodus 3:1 KJV

    1. Now Moses kept the flock of Jethro his father in law, the priest of Midian: and he led the flock to the backside of the desert, and came to the mountain of God, even to Horeb.

 

There was something that Moses was meant to learn from Zipporah that would help him shepherd the people of God, that was why God placed him in that family. He did this work for 40 years and I believe that broke something in him and rebuilt another virtue in him. The shepherdic ministry is precious in God's heart.

 

Numbers 27:16 KJV

  1. Let the LORD, the God of the spirits of all flesh, set a man over the congregation,

 

Anywhere God gathers people, He sets a man over them. God does not gather people who are on their own without placing authority over them. The word ‘set man’ being used to refer to ministers in the church is scriptural. God does not set men, he sets a man, and others are meant to support the man. If you are in a local assembly and you are not supporting the one God has set, you are causing a lot of problems and the Lord Jesus will not be happy with you.

 

Numbers 27:17 KJV

  1. Which may go out before them, and which may go in before them, and which may lead them out, and which may bring them in; that the congregation of the LORD be not as sheep which have

no shepherd.

 

This is a man that God trained for the shepherdic ministry for 40 years.

Numbers 27:18 KJV

  1. And the LORD said unto Moses, Take thee Joshua the son of Nun, a man in whom is the spirit, and lay thine hand upon him;

 

He knows who God is and knows that what God was saying is right. There is no point in time when God gathers people and tells them to do what they like, with that approach, nothing will be achieved.

 

There is a need for shepherds; shepherds are men after God's own heart. God first raises a shepherd and then He brings people around him by configuring a state of heart that can accommodate the people He is leading to them. The scripture that says ‘he gave gifts to men’ does not mean that it is the church that will elect a pastor, it is not like that, God is the one who raises a man and connects Him to people.

 

1 Samuel 22:1 KJV

  1. David therefore departed thence, and escaped to the cave Adullam: and when his brethren and all his father's house heard

it, they went down thither to him.

 

This is a man that God has raised at the back side of the wilderness and was jealous for souls. He can fight and lay down his life for souls and God can send people that have issues to him, so that the grace upon that man will help them.

 

1 Samuel 22:2 KJV

  1. And every one that was in distress, and every one that was in debt, and every one that was discontented, gathered themselves unto him; and he became a captain over them: and there were

with him about four hundred men.

 

This scripture makes us see that first of all, he was raised and God moved people towards him.

 

Psalms 78:52 KJV

(52) But made his own people to go forth like sheep, and guided them in the wilderness like a flock.

 

God's people should be like sheep so that the shepherd would be able to shepherd them accordingly. There is also something interesting in the book of Luke when Jesus was born. I understand that it is not only shepherds that work by night, there are also night guards but the angels did not appear to the guards but to the shepherds. This shows that there is something unique about shepherds that attracts heaven.

 

Luke 2:8 KJV

  1. And there were in the same country shepherds abiding in the field, keeping watch over their flock by night.

 

This is one of the duties of shepherds, they watch over your soul. Shepherds lead, feed and watch; they are watchmen that have oversight.

Luke 2:9-10 KJV

  1. And, lo, the angel of the Lord came upon them, and the glory of the Lord shone round about them: and they were sore afraid

  2. And the angel said unto them, Fear not: for, behold, I bring you good tidings of great joy, which shall be to all people.

 

They were the first people that got the news. There is something about shepherds that we must not play with. When you play with shepherds that God sends, you are disconnecting yourself from God’s allocation.

 

Psalms 78:70 KJV

(70) He chose David also his servant, and took him from the sheepfolds:

 

One of the attitudes you must take as sheep is that you do not play with feeding because this is the core assignment of shepherds. Fight anything that wants to stop you from feeding, for if you are not feeding, you are not receiving the shepherd. To receive a shepherd is to be fed by the shepherds. Shepherds are not saddled primarily with the responsibility of giving you prophetic words, they are meant to feed you with the word of God. How do you receive shepherds that the Lord sends to you? Make sure you prepare your heart to be fed.

 

Jeremiah 3:15 KJV

(15) And I will give you pastors according to mine heart, which shall feed you with knowledge and understanding.

 

Don't play with feeding, that is one of the major works of a shepherd. If feeding is not important, Satan will not fight you concerning it. The blessing that Jesus gave your shepherd for you is your feeding, your food is with that man. When you get born again, one of the major things the Holy Ghost will want to do is to help you locate your shepherd. There are many people roaming in the Body without finding their own fold. A fold is like a battalion in military terms over whom a captain is set. It might be a group of 50 or 100 but they always have a leader or captain over them. In the military, all do not just go to war as they will, there is an order, they have captains over them. If you have not found a fold, you are a potential prey and what the Holy Ghost will do is to orchestrate your steps into your own fold for the work to start in you. The fact that you are in a church does not mean that you are part of a fold, a fold is a connection in the spiritual. Everyone in the fold is imprinted or inscribed on the heart of the shepherd.

 

 

John 10:14 KJV

  1. I am the good shepherd, and know my sheep, and am known of mine.

 

There is a knowing that is spiritual, it is a connection in the heart. When you enter the flock, you enter the shepherd’s heart. Anytime Satan wants to assault you, the shepherd will pick it because you are in the shepherd’s heart. You should not just sit in church, you ought to sit in the heart of the shepherd. This is why when They want to increase an assembly, the heart of the shepherd will first be enlarged because the assembly has to be carried in his heart. If you are really connected to your shepherd, there is nothing about your life that your shepherd will not know about, and if he does not know, when he goes to God, he has the legal permission to get an answer concerning you. So, if you find a shepherd and you are well-submitted, you should not be confused; however, trusting that grace is the major problem. It is very easy to live as a Christian but Satan makes it difficult. Just trusting the people that Jesus has placed over you is all you need to journey successfully on this path. If you do that, you will not have any problem, your life will play out well. I have many first hand examples to this effect. I remember when I first came to church I was not trusting as I am now, and I know I still need to trust more. I was not trusting but was a bit sceptical. As a student, I used to travel from Ife to Lagos for meetings until I was connected to Daddy in Ibadan. When I came to see him in Ibadan, I had a lot of questions in my heart but I did not voice them out. However, as I listened to him talk, he picked each of those questions in my heart and answered them while we conversed; I did not tell him anything.

 

When you come to an assembly and the words spoken are connected to you, it is not ordinary. Some of us have tried going to other churches, and we found out that what they were saying were in no way connected to us at all; it is because those people are not sent to you, that is not your fold. When you get born again, you must find your fold. If you do not find your fold, you will be exposed to evil.

 

1 Peter 5:1-2 KJV

    1. The elders which are among you I exhort, who am also an elder, and a witness of the sufferings of Christ, and also a

partaker of the glory that shall be revealed:

    1. Feed the flock of God which is among you, taking the oversight thereof, not by constraint, but willingly; not for filthy

lucre, but of a ready mind;

 

These people are shepherds being given instructions to feed the flock. The person that has oversight over you is the person feeding you. Issues concerning your life will be accurately attended to by the one that has oversight over you. Jesus does not give the oversight of a saint to many people, that is confusion, it is one man that oversees you per time. Some believers are not wise, the private issues of their life that should be handled by oversight are what they share with just anybody who advises them based on experience and not by grace; the Holy Ghost is not involved in such counsels.

 

If you are well connected to the fold, your life will play out naturally. For instance, before my wife got pregnant, I sensed it because a thought came to my heart in that season but I got confirmation on one of those days I was talking with Daddy. He called me to his office and counselled me about what to do in that season. Also, concerning picking the date for my wedding, Daddy picked the appropriate date for us. Left to us, we would have made it a later date and we probably may not have been married till now because exactly two weeks after my wedding, the nationwide COVID-19 lockdown began. Your life is better and easier when you follow your shepherds; it is Satan that tells you to do otherwise because he is a wicked spirit that wants to isolate you from the fold. He knows it is difficult for him to reach you while you are in the fold because of the protection that is within the fold so he tries to bring you out.

 

There is also warfare within the fold. There is warfare within the fold where sheep are gathered; there is always an attempt to cut the connection between the shepherd and the sheep. Satan wants to cut off that connection so that there is no flow anymore. He pushes you to a corner, where the word can no longer be accessible to you.

 

Hebrews 13:7 KJV

(7) Remember them which have the rule over you, who have spoken unto you the word of God: whose faith follow, considering

the end of their conversation.

 

Your natural parents, as long as they are not teaching you the word, do not have this oversight over you. Be wise enough to know those that Jesus has placed over you as far as the journey to inheritance and eternal life is concerned. You cannot just sleep and find yourself on the throne when you wake up; there are details involved. Anyone

 

that will sit on the throne must have been under oversight and there are prerequisites to get there.

 

Be careful of people that speak against your shepherds. Those that have rule over you are those that are speaking over you. The scriptures are better understood now that the hope of eternal life is getting clear.

 

Hebrews 13:7 was written in the context of an assembly or a fold going to eternal life, that is the end of the conversation.

 

Hebrews 13:17 KJV

(17) Obey them that have the rule over you, and submit yourselves: for they watch for your souls, as they that must give account, that they may do it with joy, and not with grief: for that is unprofitable for you.

 

These things are the postures that the flock must take to access grace from the shepherds. It is not everyone that has rule over you. The associate pastors do not have rule over you, they are to support the ones (Daddy and Mummy) who have rule over you. That word ‘rule’ is governmental, it shows that authority has been given. The people who stand in those offices do not even covet such positions because they understand that it requires a lot of sacrifice; it is death to them also. There are people that like it, they like to command and instruct others, it is a sign that they are not worthy of being shepherds.

 

Obey them that have rule over you, Jesus gave them rule over you. Your soul was purchased, you are not your own, Jesus purchased you and handed you over to someone that will be attending to you. Obey them and submit yourself to them, these are instructions to the flocks.

 

Hebrews 13:17 KJV

(17) Obey them that have the rule over you, and submit yourselves: for they watch for your souls, as they that must give

account, that they may do it with joy, and not with grief: for that is unprofitable for you.

 

In other words, the Lord has entrusted this work to them and they will give account. If people understand this, they will think twice before they start praying for God to give them two million cogregations. People that pray for such things see empire

building but they do not think of souls. If you have two million souls and none of them were able to return to God, your judgement will be tougher. So having a huge number of congregants is not something that should be desired.

 

There is a perverse way we see Jesus. We think of Him as a nice, gentleman, American Jesus who does not shout but is always smiling and gentle, even when you are wrong; that is not who Jesus is. Don't play with that Being. He is not like that, He is very tough when it comes to this.

 

2 Corinthians 5:11 KJV

  1. Knowing therefore the terror of the Lord, we persuade men; but we are made manifest unto God; and I trust also are

made manifest in your consciences.

 

He is tough. Some of us have not even seen that aspect of Him because we have not grown up.

 

Hebrews 13:17 KJV

(17) Obey them that have the rule over you, and submit yourselves: for they watch for your souls, as they that must give account, that they may do it with joy, and not with grief: for that is unprofitable for you.

 

They must give an account. Jesus gave an account of the twelve. He was a shepherd and flocks were sent to Him.

 

John 17:12 KJV

  1. While I was with them in the world, I kept them in thy name: those that thou gavest me I have kept, and none of them is lost, but the son of perdition; that the scripture might be fulfilled.

 

These things are true and are real; it is a serious matter.

 

Matthew 9:36 KJV

(36) But when he saw the multitudes, he was moved with compassion on them, because they fainted, and were scattered abroad, as sheep having no shepherd.

The word ‘faint’ here is not referring to physical fainting but spiritual. Many are fainting, they have no strength to obey God. They are sitting in darkness and have given up as far as pursuing God is concerned. Scattering abroad here is an operation, you can be seated physically in church and still be scattered abroad. One of the things a shepherd does is to gather you and give you one hope.

 

We are seeing scriptures playing out in our days because these things are commonplace today. Shepherds are not there to teach you how to make money, those days when such happened in churches, it was because shepherds had not been raised but the days of ignorance, the Lord has winked at.

 

Matthew 12:30 KJV

  1. He that is not with me is against me; and he that gathereth not with me scattereth abroad.

 

Jesus is gathering His people through His ministry gifts. Many souls have been scattered, they have ‘twenty-five’ visions, for instance, when they should have one. Your goal should be one - eternal life, but you have many, that means you are scattered abroad. Your commitments are in different areas but when you meet a shepherd, he gathers you together and gives you a focus; anyone that is not doing that is against the Chief Shepherd. There are people in church that are against Him, they are scattering souls. Jesus Christ is not nice, sometimes if He passes judgement, it goes beyond you and can touch your children's children. If blessings can go as far as the fourth generation, how much more a curse. There are some things you do not play with, as long as Jesus is concerned, you must be very careful.

 

Satan wants to scatter people abroad so one of the things he does is that he tries to attack the shepherd to be able to do that. There are messages that scatter people abroad, it is a teaching that scatters souls. You can hear a counsel that will scatter your soul.

 

Matthew 26:31 KJV

  1. Then saith Jesus unto them, All ye shall be offended because of me this night: for it is written, I will smite the

shepherd, and the sheep of the flock shall be scattered abroad.

 

The scripture says: if you search for me with all your heart, you will find me. However, if your soul is scattered, how will you find God? You cannot find God with

twenty-percent attention, it has to be with the whole of your heart. Shepherds put you together to be able to focus on God; you need maximum focus to find God.

 

When people come to this kind of path and teaching begins, things start happening to them. For instance, their relatives may begin to fight them because their commitment is directed at one thing - God. This usually happens because the ones that are scattered abroad do not understand the one that is being gathered. Many are scattered abroad, and if you are scattered, you will be a prey.

 

Interpretation of Tongues

I am giving you wisdom, for to fight, for to wrestle, to contend with the mouth of the adversary. For many already have the mouth of the lion, and when they speak, they speak as the lion, wanting to devour you but I am granting you wisdom, wisdom to fight, to contend, to resist, to stop the lion from speaking to you. If you do not stop the lion, he will devour you. Stop and fight the lion, stop the mouth so that the mouth no longer has power over your souls. Stop the mouth of the lion. I grant you wisdom to fight and stop the mouth of the lion. Wage war with the mouths that are fighting you, for there are mouths already fighting you. Wage war with that mouth and you will overcome.

 

Message Continues

 

Matthew 26:31 KJV

(31) Then saith Jesus unto them, All ye shall be offended because of me this night: for it is written, I will smite the

shepherd, and the sheep of the flock shall be scattered abroad.

 

How does this happen? He just gives the shepherd another focus and, through that, scatters the sheep.

 

John 10:12 KJV

(12) But he that is an hireling, and not the shepherd, whose own the sheep are not, seeth the wolf coming, and leaveth the sheep, and fleeth: and the wolf catcheth them, and scattereth the sheep.

 

If you have received any counsel that is affecting your focus and commitment, you are being scattered; speak out to any of the pastors.

John 10:12 KJV

  1. But he that is an hireling, and not the shepherd, whose own the sheep are not, seeth the wolf coming, and leaveth the sheep,

and fleeth: and the wolf catcheth them, and scattereth the sheep.

 

Wolves scatter sheeps. I used to think wolves eat sheep but this scripture makes us see that wolves scatter sheeps and give the sheep many kinds of vision. When you are attacked by wolves, you cannot be focused anymore. When your commitment reduces, it reflects in other things because somewhere, wolves have attacked you, someone has spoken to you.

 

Acts 20:29-30 KJV

    1. For I know this, that after my departing shall grievous wolves enter in among you, not sparing the flock.

    2. Also of your own selves shall men arise, speaking perverse things, to draw away disciples after them.

 

As a flock, you must be wise. Be careful who you speak with; if anyone tells you things against your shepherd, go and report them to leadership. Men that refuse to agree with the message over time can also become wolves. Be careful of listening to things that are against what you are hearing.

 

Acts 20:28 KJV

(28) Take heed therefore unto yourselves, and to all the flock, over the which the Holy Ghost hath made you overseers, to feed the church of God, which he hath purchased with his own blood.

 

For you to survive in the New Testament church, you have to be very wise. You must know those that are placed over you, know those that are in alignment with the set man. Don't be foolish in that area, be wise. If you are a sheep and you are not as wise as a serpent, you will be eaten by wolves.

 

Romans 16:17 KJV

(17) Now I beseech you, brethren, mark them which cause divisions and offences contrary to the doctrine which ye have learned; and avoid them.

Division is scattering. All the brethren in church have only one thing to help you with - to obey the message, anything outside that is evil. Your brother should encourage you to push more in obedience to the things that are taught.

 

Matthew 10:16 KJV

(16) Behold, I send you forth as sheep in the midst of wolves: be ye therefore wise as serpents, and harmless as doves.

 

Keep yourself also. We cannot screen everybody that comes to church, so you have the responsibility to keep yourself. Pastors also are walking in love and trusting that God will work on men so they cannot send some believers out of the church. If you attend teachings diligently, you will have wisdom. People are foolish because they don't attend to teachings. Teachings give enough wisdom to keep you, so all you need is to hear teaching very well. I wonder at how some believers behave. They hear something in church but go out to do otherwise.

 

Jesus knows that around New Testament teachings, all kinds of things are lurking at the corner. Pastor said that Satan is more interested in a New Testament gathering than in a club house. The Manchild company cannot be raised in a club house, it is demons that need to watch the people in club houses but spiritual wickedness, pricipalies, powers, fouls of the air, come to where the word of the kingdom is being taught. You must be wise, listen to the doctrine well and be careful. For some, what puts them into traps is their covetousness. Satan can use covetousness to trap you. Having an appetite that you have not allowed the Lord to tame can cause you to fall prey. You have to be content to keep yourself from things that defile. The Lord will help us, the Lord will give us wisdom. Don't try to do any shaddy thing without telling your Pastor, you're killing yourself that way. Daddy and Mummy are not children, they have spiritual expertise. If earthly organisations know how to commit important things to only skilled individuals, how much more God.

 

Pst. Dimeji Elugbadebo

You don't need to be spared, if not, Satan will devour you. To devour a soul is to scatter a soul. When you are scattered, you have been devoured. There is an extent that you will be scattered to an extent that you cannot be restored again, where you cannot be reached by God anymore.

 

There was a time in my life that I strayed and I suffered for it but God had mercy on me. I had a good start and was raised by pastors, so I grew up healthy.

 

Interpretation of Tongues

It is you, I am ministering to you, don't think of someone else, accept that it is you and turn, turn and come back under for you are being lost already. Acknowledge that you are being lost and come back under. I want to restore you. There is still grace for you to be restored, don't allow yourself to be fully devoured till I can no longer restore you. Don't go too far from my hand, for if my hand is stretched out to you and it cannot reach you, then you have gone far. I want to restore you. I am bringing help, receive it, don’t think it is not you, receive it, I want to do a work of restoration, bringing many back under, under the shepherd’s tents that I previously led them in.

 

Message Continues

I know what it means to stray experientially. I think God allowed that so that I can value what it means to be a shepherd under Christ. You can still be receiving revelation even when you have strayed. There was a time that I was not paying tithe because I believed that I was the tithe; I suffered through those seasons. There is no way you will go through that and you will not be thorough. Some believe that we do not know what you are doing, we know; we are just praying for you and in some other cases, we want you to learn from your experience; some need to learn that way so that the lesson can stick better.

 

Pastor Friday really blessed us today. I was wondering how he got those scriptures from the Old Testament; I never saw those scriptures that way. If you see anyone that does not like pastors, they have an Egyptian soul.

 

Souls need to be domesticated by truth. When you compare a domesticated cat and a wild cat, the wild cat is very fierce like a lion.

 

Many believers are wild, and there are ministers like that; they have gifts but they are wild. If you are streaming their messages, they will deal with you. There are some apostles that talk down on church. You will be listening to them and your understanding of the new testament will drop. I know major apostles in Nigeria that talk against the church; those are not true apostles. No New Testament apostle will hate church. One of the signs that you took milk well is that you will love church and love pastors. If someone does not grow well in a family, it will show but when someone grows up well in a good family, there is a way they are structured. Church work is a holistic work, it is well structured; if there are things you lacked while growing up in your natural family, you can get it in Church.

 

You will grow if you are under. Growth is very natural, it is an organic process that should happen to you naturally. If anyone is stuck and not growing, that means they are not believing. Unbelief is attached to spiritual age; it is natural to children. If a soul is not believing, it is because they have lost the posture of a sheep. If you have stopped feeding amongst the flock, you will not grow.

 

The grace of Jesus rests on pastors, so if your pastors are preaching, you must hear Jesus. If you are in a church and you are hearing Jesus, go to where you can hear Jesus. You must hear the voice of Jesus in your shepherd. Many believers do not even know the voice of Jesus.

 

We do a lot of work to make sure that you understand this.

 

Matthew 9:36 KJV

(36) But when he saw the multitudes, he was moved with compassion on them, because they fainted, and were scattered abroad, as sheep having no shepherd.

 

Pastoral work must take a certain kind of shape. It is possible that a church has multitudes but does not have pastoral structure. The bigger a church grows, the smaller it should be. If we have a ten thousand congregation, we must have stronger pastoral units, that is the only way you can account for them. God is not against numbers but there must be structure that can cater for people pastorally. Heaven does not judge the quality of a church by the number of people there but by how the saints there are being attended to and cared for.

 

When you faint, it means you are not eating. You will not eat when there is food because of lack of appetite and what causes that is sickness. You can be well-dressed, wearing jeans, a tie, and perfumes but your soul is sick. When you are not feeding, over time, it will show.

 

At times, you can escape pastoral radar. God was teaching me that there are some souls that can camouflage, they have learnt the stealth way in the spirit. You can be hypocritical or pretentious but we will catch you very soon or you will be exposed. It is good for you to be exposed.

While growing up, anytime I wanted to do something wrong, I was always caught so I did not have the mind to engage in them. It is a good prayer to pray, that if you want to do any wrong thing, God should ensure that you are caught. When you keep escaping being caught, your heart becomes more hardened.

 

You will faint if you are not feeding and you will be scattered abroad. Be very careful. We have six pastors in this local assembly so if you go and get counsel from another person who is not a pastor, you are on your own. If you counsel somebody and because of your counsel, that soul dies, God will take the blood of that soul from you. If you do not repent, Jesus will judge you. Some people have killed many souls through wrong counsels.

 

We think we know what church is, even before we got born again. Many people who are being called pastors are not pastors; they are just bearing the title. The Nigerian church has gone through the feast of Jeroboam, where many that are not called are being ordained. The title is so cheap, that is why the quality is so low. They have spoiled the pastoral ministry so much that you have lost respect for it and you think all pastors are the same. All pastors are not the same, Jesus Christ has original pastors that He have been sent by to cater for the flock, to feed them well.

 

Many grew up in churches where they have been abused and Satan did all those things so that he could raise examples in the church. He has dealt with many and raised the wrong standard in the church such that the Church has become a ridicule to the world. Church will call a meeting these days and people will come late, yet they will not tremble. We don't know what the Church is. I grew up in a church where people run when they come late to church. It is because the standard has gone down that is why all manner of things are being experienced in the church. People don't know what the church is or who pastors are. The church has rule, it has government; it is not just any kind of institution. What is happening in the Nigerian church today is akin to what is recorded in the Bible - the feasts of Jeroboam where he ordained everybody as priests so that Israelites would not go back to Jerusalem. The Nigerian church has misrepresented pastoring. The pastoral responsibility is a heavenly grave responsibility, the fact that you will account before Jesus is a serious thing.

Many believers go for digital, packaged churches, and fine pastors; that cannot deal with the soul. You need unrefined, very crude anointing to deal with the soul of men. This is going to happen to the Nigerian church, it is happening already, it is happening in America and spreading fast to other nations.

 

Jeremiah 23:3 KJV

  1. And I will gather the remnant of my flock out of all countries whither I have driven them, and will bring them again to their

Even if you are a minister, that does not mean you should not have a fold. As an itinerary minister for instance, you should have a home, a church base. Apostle Paul had a church he was reporting to, so why should you not have one? He had pastors, he had people that could talk to him.

 

Jeremiah 23:4 KJ

  1. And I will set up shepherds over them which shall them: and they shall fear no more, nor be dismayed, neither shall they

When you are afraid, you are not feeding. If you are afraid of everything, afraid of your future, dominated by fear,it is because you are not feeding. To be dismayed means that you are confused. Prosperity, both of the soul and in the natural is attached to feeding. There is nobody hearing sound doctrine that will be poor. It will show in your purse over time, just wait. Sometimes, heaven can make your disobedience affect your purse so that They can get your attention. Some believers can live in disobedience for a long time without feeling it, they have not been praying, they will allow their finances to be touched to get their attention. If they don’t respond or yield to this operation, the next thing they will do is to allow your body to be touched. Some people are down with health challenges because of their unwillingness to respond to God.

 

The Lord will help us, our soul will be restored in Jesus name.

Message Begins

God is a husbandman and He is so particular about having a vineyard. When God created man, the first thing He did was to put him in the garden that He created, which means that man was not supposed to be alone.

 

Genesis 1:28 KJV

(28) And God blessed them, and God said unto them, Be fruitful, and multiply, and replenish the earth, and subdue it: and have dominion over the fish of the sea, and over the fowl of the air, and over every living thing that moveth upon the earth.

 

 

The blessing is amongst them that are sanctified.

 

Colossians 1:12 KJV

(12) Giving thanks unto the Father, which hath made us meet to be partakers of the inheritance of the saints in light:

 

Blessings come to us as a company, not one person.

Your responsibility is to see that you are aligned and responding to what God wants to do in you.

 

Ephesians 4:16 KJV

Every part has a measure and God is desirous that a people will emerge from the head, and take their parts in the whole but they must not be without head or guidance. Reference to He gave us pastors (part 1-5, year 2020).

 

God gave gifts to the church because the church is very dear to His heart.

Men will be taken away from his grip. Satan and his angels are constantly looking for more souls because they want to secure their place in the air. Unbelievers do not have souls, they are dead but believers are only lost, they have God's life in them; they can be numbered as those who are His.

                                                   1 Peter 2:25 KJV

                                                                                  1 Peter 5:4 KJV

You can go into a place where sensual things that motivate the mind towards pursuing the world are being taught but the soul is not being fed. That is not true feeding, you are just being polluted. They are men that want to spoil you who bring sensual things to spoil you.

 

Colossians 2:8 KJV

(8) Beware lest any man spoil you through philosophy and vain deceit, after the tradition of men, after the rudiments of the world, and not after Christ.

That is why many are not straight but are warped, their construction is not thorough. When you are drawing from different sources, you will be confused. There are many things that will pollute your water and when God comes to you, He cannot brood. When God comes to us, He wants to meet a still water; we have to be still for Him to come to us.

Message Continues

When the Lord sets you in a church, He knows that the resources you need for your growth are in that church but it will take sincerity and simplicity to embrace what God wants to bring to you.

 

Hebrews 13:5 KJV

(5) Let your conversation be without covetousness; and be content with such things as ye have: for he hath said, I will never leave thee, nor forsake thee.

 

Many believers are covetous, wanting another thing outside what God has ordained for them. They are either covetous for power or for some ministerial gift. It is not like it is not good to admire and covet the grace of people that have power, God gave them those gifts but those things are not enough to build up your soul. We must all understand and agree with that. When I was growing up in the faith, I used to struggle when I read the Bible and saw that Jesus did not do any miracle until He was 30. I

 

thought that as powerful as He is, it is not possible that He did not do any miracle before the wedding at Canaan. I just told myself, they were probably not recorded but with the coming of everlasting light, I now understand that there was a reason God shut down that area of Jesus’ life. It was not that Jesus did not have power, God just put the focus on His growth. If the average believer has the kind of power Jesus has, they would not do natural things themselves again. At times, God would not permit those gifts to be revealed because He knows we will use it for ourselves. They want to deal with selfish tendencies in our souls. Every gift that God gives is not for you, when you convert it to your personal use, you are becoming a Satan; gifts are not meant to be consumed on your lust.

 

                           James 4:3 KJV

  1. Ye ask, and receive not, because ye ask amiss, that ye may consume it upon your lusts.

 

It is mercy when you ask and you do not receive because if you receive, you will destroy yourself and even the rest of God’s population on the earth.

 

Gifts do not build souls. God does not want to raise people without virtue; men who have so much manifestation but when it comes to long suffering, they are lacking. Many times, many say they want the power of Elijah but all they want to do with it is to expend it on themselves. Why did God give Elijah power, it was to turn Israel back to God, to redeem Israel and not for him to show off. He was meant to use it to judge the prophets of Baal. When you are asking for power, examine your motive for asking for that power. True power and all the power that you need is in Christ. The scripture says that Christ has been made to us the wisdom and the power of God so if you want power, ask for Christ. Let Him turn you from mortality to immortality, let Him build you up from within; that is true power.

 

The real reason many believers want power is because they want to vaunt themselves. If you want to have power gifts, you can go on a fast for ninety days for instance. I know a friend who used to do that and he had three church branches in Ukraine before the war but when we talk about having spiritual virtues, they are scarce in the lives of many whose focus is only on gifts. There are so many things God wants to build in you and when you are coming to God, you will have to drop power. What God seeks for is virtues, substances, image and glory, this is why They give us pastors who can teach us these things. So, when your pastors come to teach you, don't get angry and believe they do not want you to ‘blow’. You cannot be allowed to 

become influential after Satan’s order in this path, if you go that way, it will be impossible to find you in God again. When Jesus called His disciples, He called them to make them, not to ‘announce them’. Church is for making, so we must love making; those who God will call must be made.

 

There are many things we do ignorantly thinking we are pleasing God but He is not pleased. The wrought of man does not work the righteousness of God, just receive with meekness the engrafted word of God that can save your soul. If you are not doing that, you are not walking purposefully. We have a very short time on this path of life, and as God has set us under shepherds to receive feeding, stay there and learn all you need to know. God knows the time every man has, so we need to submit to His work in us. There are works that prevent many from submitting to the shepherds God has set over them so, instead of them being built up in the duration of time God has set, their building is being delayed.

 

Joseph was also a shepherd, he was shepherding Jesus. We do not know so many things about Joseph, but I believe he was a man of stature, that was why heaven could entrust so much to him. I believe that in the world to come, he would be a man of honour. Like Joseph, we should be men who are not seeking to be known but doing the work of God with all diligence.

 

If the Lord knows that it will take twenty years for your process to come into Christ to be completed, He will place you somewhere where you will be fed in order to come to that point. For some of us, because of friends, perspectives, it takes longer for the work in us to be done; many do not even align at all. God has His own curriculum, just as we have curriculum in schools; God’s curriculum are the mysteries of Christ, the Father and God. For instance, if you are meant to do a course in each aspect of that curriculum for three months but you fail to submit yourself to the shepherd who is meant to teach you, you can stay at that point for as long as ten years. The Israelites were meant to journey to the promised land in 40 days but it took them 40 years. Moses was a shepherd and God had to train him for forty years so that he could lead His people. Israel was just meant to follow Moses so that they could come to God. Moses used to go to the mountain and he did not die, but they refused to follow him, which means that they did not believe in Moses, so they could not come into God.

The Bible is precise, it did not order it differently, the right way is word and prayer, not prayer and ministry of the word. We are all meant to pray, prayer is a continuous activity that we must give ourselves to as believers but the paramount calling that will cause us to grow up is the ministry of the word. If you constantly drink water without eating, you will be malnourished; it may even lead to death because all the nutrients the body needs to grow are not present. There was a time the Israelites did not have water in the wilderness for instance, but they were constantly being fed with manna daily. This is not to play down on prayer, prayer is important, we should pray, but the word is much more important. You ate a kind of food which made you the way you are (carnal man) but you must also eat another kind of food to be changed. The ministry of the word must be exalted. Closing Exhortation Pst Dimeji Elugbadebo

The dispensation upon the church that is bringing the church to fullness will rely upon proper New Testament pastors. We are still at a very fundamental place in the work but as the work grows, God will raise more New Testament pastors. Apostle Paul was a New Testament apostle, but he raised a lot of pastors over the work like Timothy and Titus who were also New Testament pastors; They had apostolic grace. Pastors of New Testament churches are Pastors with apostolic authority to make sure that the flock is well attended to.

 

We are beginning to see clearly the role of New Testament pastors and the local church. When I see people who are not well pastored, it shows in their conversation. Most gifted people who are not pastored well give pastors problems. Schools of ministry for pastors can only supply information, New Testament ministers cannot be raised from Bible schools.

 

Pastors are first flocks before they become shepherds. You must have flocked well so that the characteristics of flocks are fully developed in you. You cannot lead a flock if you have not followed well.

 

You must know the journey of the pastors in the church you want to be a part of. Don't just put yourself under anyone, check well by the Spirit. This is why young men who have never served and grown under authority should not be pastors. They may have oratory skills and can make people fall under the anointing but there is a difference between power manifestation and true power. The Corinthian church had all the gifts of the spirit but they were still carnal. What changes the state of a man and makes them vessels that can bear His authority is true power.

 

The local church is central to the work of building and the dispensation of presenting the church perfectly before God. God is still in the process of setting the solitary in families and He sets men over the church.

 

God has a system of order, it is through that system that souls are attended to and they grow up. Your desire should be to grow up; it is abnormal for a believer to desire that God should use him or give him power. That is the real abnormal, even though we have been used to it, it is still not the right order.

 

People that minister in the New Testament church are put under chains, it is the sovereign will of God that makes them that way; it is not an ambition. The reason people have an ambition is because of the gain they desire, if you wield an ambition around ministry, you don't know what ministry is.

 

In today’s teaching, I saw the system of church governance that was in the early church; it was so strong. When we were much younger in the faith, we did not understand this. The New Testament church is very governmental; church is not fellowship. When I wanted to start church, Reverend Kayode said I should call it church and not fellowship. We were looking for less offensive names to use to tag the work because we did not want people to be afraid; using the word fellowship is less offensive than using church. The church is governmental; the atmosphere of the New Testament church is very governmental and God is restoring this order back.

 

2 Corinthians 8:22 KJV

 

  1. And we have sent with them our brother, whom we have oftentimes proved diligent in many things, but now much more

diligent, upon the great confidence which I have in you.

 

In choosing men who would work with the apostles, those who had gifts were not considered but men who were faithful servants were selected. They had no regard for anyone, all they chose were proved. All the people that worked with Paul were serving with churches. They travelled with Paul and in seasons where they are not working, go back to their churches. Not just any kind of man was presented to Paul, only men everyone loved and knew had hearts of service. That’s how he picked men for apostolic work; Paul did not just pick anointed or gifted men, he picked people who had character. Why? If you are working with an apostle and you are well submitted, in a few months, his grace can rest on you. That anointing is not really your own but is being given by the Lord. God can anoint an apostolic personality, raise a team around him and put measures of anointing on them. God can take from that anointing that is on a man and anoint others to fill in the work for that same apostolic flow. God is a very orderly person, so if you are working with a minister, you must understand that you are not apart from the grace, you are just a compliment to the grace.

 

2 Corinthians 8:23 KJV

  1. Whether any do enquire of Titus, he is my partner and fellowhelper concerning you: or our brethren be enquired of,

they are the messengers of the churches, and the glory of Christ.

Christ is God.

 

It means that Jesus understands the concept of covering very well. Pastors carry the covering of Christ; that office has been attacked severally. If you are not under pastors God has placed over you, you are not under His covering. Many believers are not accounted for, they are just roaming about in the church. Some are even doing ministry that God did not send them to do. Not everybody is sent to you, only your pastors are sent to you. We get blessed by three major means.

  1. Your local church that you are accountable to and are a visible member there; that is the first place of feeding. The pastoral ministry is for feeding, it is not for titles. We will still look deeper into all these things and how it all works. Copastors work along with pastors, it is a team. Copastors cannot just bring out their own message, the Lord will only cast direction through the senior pastor of the church.

When other flocks are feeding and one sheep goes astray, the shepherd leaves the other sheep and goes to look for the lost sheep. It means that sheep has strayed away from the normal grazing route and when it is seen, the rod is used to break the leg of such a sheep. Some sheep stray away totally, so the shepherd’s staff which is u-shaped is used to bring them back into alignment. The work of a shepherd is not easy.

 

Some people have to be broken so that they can be brought back to the fold. At times, sheep think they are wise and know what to eat.

 

I have a pastor, Reverend Kayode Oyegoke is my Pastor and there are things I get as instruction from him.

 

  1. Body ministries sent to equip ministers, pastors, and the flock. For example, Eternal Glorious Fountain Ministry (EGFM) is raised to equip ministers and churches in the Body. That is why Pastor Emeka, Pastor Thompson and also other pastors have churches around these waters so that believers can be a part of a local assembly. You cannot be listening to the word online and you are not gathered onsite, if you are in this category, it should be for a season, not a constant occurrence. God is looking for how to set you and the things you are hearing is just to

 

prepare you. There is no way you can carry God’s nature without being gathered. You cannot be streaming online, processing messages yourself and expect to attain unto everlasting life; everlasting life is given among.

 

  1. Your own personal time of fellowship.

 

I am not comfortable when believers feed anyhow. If you trust us as your pastors, you should let us know when you want to read some materials; either books or messages. I recommend books from the pulpit and you can even ask pastors about the materials you want to read. You can read some materials or listen to messages that can injure you. For instance, some ministers make saints prayer machines but your growth as a believer is tied to feeding; fasting and praying outside feeding will not help you. You will not grow but will only be a spiritist. When people still have sin but are desiring power, they fall under the anointing and are excited, yet they are still not growing spiritually.

 

In the New Testament, there are important things we must give attention to for growth, not just engaging in spiritual exercises in vain. If you see praying for 72 hours as more important than sitting down to learn, you are roaming around the Body. You do not really have power if you cannot sit down to take sound doctrine. You have not listened to your unit head and you want to hear the voice of the Head of the church; that is not possible. The first time Samuel heard the voice of the Lord, it was through Eli's voice. If Samuel was not under authority, he would not have been able to hear God.

 

There are many hirelings in the body that God did not send, their gifts sent them.

The essence of this teaching and the last one is not to emphasize pastors as men but to see the pastoral grace; we are not talking about the pastor as a man but as an office, as a grace allocation in our Lord Jesus. The five-fold gifts are from Jesus, the head of the Church, and they are the Head-Body gifts, the gifts from the Head, for the Body.

 

Ephesians 4:8 KJV

(8) Wherefore he saith, When he ascended up on high, he led captivity captive, and gave gifts unto men.

 

Jesus ascended to a height to give men as gifts to the Body. Pastor has explained how the Apostle Paul fetched this scripture from Psalms 68.

 

Psalms 68:18 KJV

(18) Thou hast ascended on high, thou hast led captivity captive: thou hast received gifts for men; yea, for the rebellious also,

that the LORD God might dwell among them.

 

In this scripture, we should pay attention to the word - receive. When Jesus ascended on high, He received an allocation, which we call the five-fold, for men. Through the word 'gave' as used in Ephesians 4, we might really get the concept but we see in Psalms 68 that Jesus received a gift from a realm called - high; this high is the highest realm. The gifts He received are high gifts; they are gifts received from the heights of God and they are to bring men to the heights of God.

 

Ephesians 4:9-10 KJV

  1. (Now that he ascended, what is it but that he also descended first into the lower parts of the earth?

  2. He that descended is the same also that ascended up far above all heavens, that he might fill all things.)

 

In this scripture, the point of His ascension is spoken about.

 

Ephesians 4:11 KJV

  1. And he gave some, apostles; and some, prophets; and some, evangelists; and some, pastors and teachers;

 

As a result of this ascension, He now gave gifts. Also from Psalms 68, we see that He received all these offices, dimensions and operations, and these are also found in 1 Corinthians 12.

 

Pastors are preachers and teachers and the teachings they are to do will take men back to the heights.

 

Ephesians 4:12-13 KJV

  1. For the perfecting of the saints, for the work of the ministry, for the edifying of the body of Christ:

  2. Till we all come in the unity of the faith, and of the knowledge of the Son of God, unto a perfect man, unto the

measure of the stature of the fulness of Christ:

 

Jesus Christ descended and ascended in order to receive gifts for the perfection of the saints. There is a destination in view, the place Jesus Christ ascended to. The gifts were given to bring the church to her inheritance; her inheritance is not in the planes, it is in the heights.

 

Ephesians 1:22-23 KJV

  1. And hath put all things under his feet, and gave him to be the head over all things to the church,

  2. Which is his body, the fulness of him that filleth all in all.

 

Jesus is the Head over all things to the Church. Pastor has said in the past that the five-fold are supposed to grow into shepherds because it is a shepherd that can take ‘all things’ and use it to grow the church so that the church can also fill all in all.

 

The reason for all these is for us to know that there is no growth in the church, particularly local churches, outside pastoral grace.

 

The things stated in the scriptures are situated in contexts, they are not lopsided. You cannot say you are growing up and you are not growing into the head, and you are not entering into the inheritance. Also, we do not have many inheritances; it is one inheritance, one hope which scripture calls ‘one hope of your calling’.

 

Through the book of Ephesians Chapter 1, we know that your calling is His calling, so if you do not know this calling, which is the calling of your inheritance. The pastoral grace is to bring you to that calling, to that destination; they show you how to get to that destination.

 

Psalms 23:2 KJV

(2) He maketh me to lie down in green pastures: he leadeth me beside the still waters.

 

This scripture is not out of context, it is to bring the sheep back to the inheritance. This “I will not want” in Psalm 23:1 means you will not want anything that will bring you back to God who is the inheritance.”

 

Pastors are to teach and feed the flock.

 

Jeremiah 3:15 KJV

(15) And I will give you pastors according to mine heart, which shall feed you with knowledge and understanding.

 

Many believers do not know that the word pastor exists in the Old Testament, as stated here in the book of Jeremiah. What knowledge is this scripture referring to? What I am teaching is why we need pastoral grace and how we are to be blessed by them. They are not feeding us with an esoteric substance, the feeding is the knowledge and understanding of something. Feeding in church is not just feeding in anything, the flock is to be fed with knowledge and understanding. However, we must also understand the knowledge of what we need to be fed with.

 

Jeremiah 23:4 KJV

(4) And I will set up shepherds over them which shall feed them: and they shall fear no more, nor be dismayed, neither shall they

The context of the experience in this scripture is really in the local church. This feeding will not make men fear.

 

Jeremiah 23:3 KJV

The feeding of the church is in the context of the local church and it is to make the church fruitful and increase the saints in the fold. It is in our fruitfulness that we will not fear anymore. Any flock that is not doing well under the shepherdic grace will be a fearful flock that is dismayed and lacking in many things towards the inheritance.

 

It is not anything you think you lack that will be given to you as a flock, it is the will that determines what you lack.

This filling is through feeding. Jeremiah did not explain the will but this book of Colossians is showing us that it is the will that we are to be fed with. What pastoral grace feeds with is the will.

 

Ephesians 5:17 KJV

    1. Wherefore be ye not unwise, but understanding what the will of the Lord is.

Colossians 1:9 KJV

      1. For this cause we also, since the day we heard it, do not cease to pray for you, and to desire that ye might be filled with

The shepherdic grace is a grace that works with wisdom; it is wisdom that enables them to feed, not the wisdom of the world but that which is from above.

 

Colossians 1:10 KJV

      1. That ye might walk worthy of the Lord unto all pleasing, being fruitful in every good work, and increasing in the

As a result of the shepherdic grace, flocks are meant to follow and walk worthy. There is a destination in view for the shepherd and the flock relationship, it is to bring the flock into all pleasing - her inheritance.

 

The will of God will teach the flock what to do. There is something about man that does not want to do anything except something of his own. The average man wants to be without guidance, government and tutoring. But the shepherdic grace supplies the area of ‘what to do’. So, teachings in instruction and doctrine come every time, particularly in the context of the local church, to show us what to do. The irony is that you can be in the ministry experience of the work and don’t know all these details.

 

1 Corinthians 12:28 KJV

(28) And God hath set some in the church, first apostles, secondarily prophets, thirdly teachers, after that miracles, then

The shepherdic grace supplies government to the flock.

There is meant to be a governing force over the flock for them to come into their inheritance. Government here does not mean control, it is meant to enforce what is right because the soul does not know what is right. Man used to know what is right, maybe in the garden before man fell but after that point, man has journeyed in a way

 

where man no longer knows what’s right. So, the soul - which is the church - strayed away from knowing what is right.

 

1 Peter 2:25 KJV

(25) For ye were as sheep going astray; but are now returned unto the Shepherd and Bishop of your souls.

 

The sheep went astray because of sin but now they ought to return; the shepherdic grace has something to enforce, to make souls come back. If any flock is not under shepherdic grace, they will go astray like the prodigal son; such souls will be migrants. To be a prodigal son does not mean being out of church, you might be in a local church, yet you are not following, you have gone astray. Although others are under and following, you are not.

 

Again, I want us to look at the book of Ruth in order to see wisdom pertaining to the topic - the Shepherdic Tent which can also be called sherpherdic house. The shepherd’s tent is not a physical house or building, the tent signifies the shepherdic grace, a spiritual house or an office the shepherd enters all the time. Even when a shepherd does not have a physical office, he has an office in the spirit and that office is the tent, that is where he functions from.

It is time for them to go back and relate well with the shepherdic grace.

Interpretation of Tongues

He is pulling you away, he wants to take you away and waste the resources, and waste the substances I am putting in you. Be wise, he wants to lead you away where he will exploit all that I have put in you. You have substances in you, you have received measures, additions, keep the things you have received, keep them. I have given you a level of sight, a level of judgment. I have delivered you to a degree, keep those things, do not let them go away, do not exchange them for vanity. I perceive that evil spirits are luring many, they want to waste things, they want waste substances; be wise, saith the Lord. Be careful how you handle the world, they want to drain you of life, of substances, be wise.

 

Message Continues

How you keep your substances is by staying in the house. By staying, this does not mean only coming to church because you can be coming to church but not retaining the substances being given.

I believe I heard Reverend Kayode Oyegeoke say recently that the five fold were given to raise the church to Christ and everlasting life, after which the Jesus takes over. Anything that the shepherdic grace supplies to us is for us to keep growing and not want.
