I need to emphasize again that you did not get born again by chance and you did not get added to a church to no end, you were quickened in your spirit to identify with a shepherdic tent.

 

I remember that the first time I came to this church was after going to BECON 2012. I was in a particular local church before and I was doing well. I went to convention

 

 

because I already knew about Reverend Kayode Oyegoke since school. As I was hearing the teachings, I was just wondering that if I got back to Ibadan, how would I be able to get access to this kind of teaching. As though the Lord heard me, almost immediately, Reverend Kayode called all the pastors in EGFM who pastored local churches and he was mentioning the cities their churches were located. He told us Pastor Dimeji was in Ibadan and asked those of us in Ibadan to meet with him. So, after the meeting, Pastor wrote down our names and said he would get back to us later. When I got back to Ibadan, I told my mum that I wanted to change my church, she asked why and I told her that I just want to get nurtured. There were several challenges that came from that angle but I thank God that I did not recede on my decision to join church. The following week after convention, daddy called to inform me of when service would be held, so I came and I remember I initially wanted to sit near where nursing mothers sit but mummy told me not to sit there but go sit at the front. Pastor taught that day about the parable of the sower.

 

I was serving in Ibadan then and many job opportunities outside the city kept opening up so I had reasons to leave and pursue them. One of them was in Osogbo and the offer included an official car and a house but I just stayed and was content playing the keyboard. I did not really stay because I was playing the keyboard but I saw a grace that I knew was for the building up of my soul.

 

Acts 20:32 KJV

  1. And now, brethren, I commend you to God, and to the word of his grace, which is able to build you up, and to give you an

inheritance among all them which are sanctified.

 

What shepherds feed with is the word of His grace.

 

There were many oppositions to my staying in Ibadan. I remember I got another job opportunity which I told Pastor about and he said I could go, maybe he was considering the fact that I needed that job to meet my natural needs but I knew I was not supposed to. The next Sunday, Pastor preached a message that made it clear to me that I was to stay. Eventually I started a job under the guidance of Daddy, stopped that, and joined another one. What I am doing right now was also by guidance.

 

 

At the beginning of this journey, I could not see the end of the path. I did not know where it would land me. If I had left against God’s instruction, maybe by now, I would have died.

 

After a long season of contentions, jobs started coming in. Not like I got a large number but it was enough for my sustenance. However, spiritual meals and bread were constant. My wife and son came as a result of my staying under them.

 

I remember a brother in the faith called me to come to Lagos at that time because my job has better prospects in Lagos but I had to be discerning. Thank God for grace to stay, I know I have evolved over time. Prophetic worship was so strong in the house then and that is how I got the prophetic grace I have now. I had to unlearn certain things in order to cleave well. Grace addresses everything in my life, it pays to stay under shepherdic tent.

 

Closing Exhortation Pastor Dimeji Elugbadebo

 

Exhortation on Tongues

These tongues are witnessing to the message so that the heart can believe. It is not easy to convince the heart. What convinces the heart of doctrine is not miracles; miracles are to convince unbelievers but when it comes to convincing the heart to believe doctrine, it is prophecy that does that work. When doctrine comes and prophecy follows, it is not cunningly-devised fables, it is to help the heart pay attention to what was said.

 

Interpretation of Tongues

I show a pattern, I show you a pattern, a pattern. It is My way, this is My way, I show you a pattern to understand My way. I bring light and understanding to make you see My way, this is the way I save. Believe this way, take this way, accept this manner, this is the manner. You have to choose Me, even though you don't have the full comprehension. Many times, I will not show you the end, but you have to choose Me, you have to do it by faith, that is how you will be saved. It is by faith, you have to follow by faith, you have to take steps by faith, you have to cleave to that witness, it is enough. You ask for many signs, the witness is enough, the witness of the word that you hear is enough. That is the way I want you to do it, it is by faith, so that you can be saved, it is by faith because it is of salvation. It is by faith, so that you can

 

 

redeemed, it is by faith, so that you can be built. It is by faith, so that your eyes can be shut and your eyes can be opened to the realm of the Spirit, saith the Lord.

 

Message Continues

At times, when God permits us to give personal testimony of our own lives, it is because God wants to use them to minister to people. I did not even know you were going through all you spoke about but I thank God that you yielded to God because it was God using you. You could have chosen to go to New and Living Way Church and I would have allowed you but that might not be what God wants for you.

 

It is possible to join yourself to a New Testament living church but if that is not where God wills for you to be, God might reach you there but you will find out that there is a place that you may not be able to have in the Spirit. These are difficult things to say but it is the truth. At times when you disobey God, in a way, you know deep down in your spirit that you are doing what you should not do but when the heart is weak, we seek options. It is possible you know that if you do something, you will die, so you begin to look for options close to that and by so doing, you are not pleasing God totally. That is why Christianity is the way it is, men are coming up with options for themselves as alternatives to obeying God. Doing what you know is not entirely God’s will, that is still Saul.

 

Under the atmosphere of the word, you get clear directions. When I counsel people sometimes, I know if they have heard God or not. Most times, I ask them what God has said and as they speak, I am able to perceive if God has spoken to them. With many, I know they have not heard from God so to be sure, I just tell them that we should wait on it. That is the point many many have problems with me because I can wait for two years with you on a matter. Papa Hagin said that it is better to be late in doing the will of God than to go ahead of God; it is better you are the one catching up with God.

 

Even if Pastor Siji lost job opportunities, what is a job compared to eternal inheritance? God can bring an industry to Ibadan just because of one person. So, that is not the first thing I think about, I first consider the purpose of God, salvation of a soul and spiritual growth.

 

It is not easy to be a New Testament pastor because you will offend many people. I have offended many people, not because I want to, I am naturally not an offensive

 

person, but I have offended many because of my stand with the truth. When you tell people to do things God’s way, that’s when you begin to see reactions because people already have personal plans. Such people begin to look for alternatives and part of that is looking for alternative counsels. This is why I do not pastor souls in other churches - even souls in sister-ministries. I do not do internet pastoring, even basic answering questions. I know a brother in Lagos that I told to go and meet Pastor Thompson. He wanted to keep following our teachings but I told him that since he knows God has not led him to Ibadan, he should go to Pastor Thompson in Lagos.

 

We are not trying to limit you. Some of you think that we do not want you to go abroad, go there and you will understand like the prodigal son did. If I tell you to wait and allow us to check certain decisions again, it is because I am trying to do my job as a pastor. It is better to delay now than to rush into certain things. The same principle applies in the area of marriage; when I tell you to wait, it is for your good. Why will you rush something now, and five years down the line, you will regret it? Something that could have been settled if you just waited a bit. However, the truth is that a large portion of the flock are children; they are ignorant so they find it difficult to believe.

 

We should all be children, but not the ignorant ones, rather, we should be children in that we are able to follow. Even as a Pastor, I am a child; I have men that I follow. There are certain decisions I cannot take on my own; I know if I take them without counsel, I will get into trouble.

 

All the fivefold are shepherdic but pastors and bishops are the closest to the flock.

 

1 Timothy 3:1 KJV

    1. This is a true saying, If a man desire the office of a bishop, he desireth a good work.

 

A bishop should work with a pastor, they form a pastoral team with the lead pastor. For instance, Timothy was a pastor under Paul. The lead pastor has a pioneering grace. Timothy had the responsibility to select his own bishops under the Holy Ghost but Paul had to tell him the criteria of selecting bishops. It is an office under the pastoral office, Reverend Kayode Oyegoke will say bishop means by shop, that is, they stay by the shop (souls).

 

The Bible also has a definition for elders, they are not simply church members that are old like we believe today in the church. We should honour men that are old in church of course but that does not make them elders. We can have older brethren in church that have wisdom but are not bishops or pastors, although they can also help the pastoral team. Where God is taking us is that our churches will be a church of elders. As a believer, you may be an elder yet never have a role in quote but you have a place. By the time we reach the book of third John, we see more of elders; those elders are those that have grown with God for years. The elders mentioned in Acts 15:2 were the saints that got born again in Acts 2, so if you grow well, you will become an elder. Everybody should be an elder. Who are elders? Elders are fathers God can have a covenant with.

 

Some people are so fixated on having titles in church but I am particular about believers having stature. The people that judge growth by the quantity of membership of a church don’t know what church really is. The best thing that can happen to you as a believer is to be a member; the highest title in the church is brother, it is higher than the title of an apostle. It is ignorance that stops us from knowing these things. To be a floor member in a progressive New Testament church is a blessing; just being there, learning and growing and loving the brethren.

 

That is why someone will join a church and is doing IT. This church started in 2013, if we are not teaching with the New Testament standard, we may have had at least four branches. If you know the number of people that have come and left this church, you will be amazed; they would have stayed if the standard was lower. When you come to this local assembly, once you stay for a while, you will understand that you must be ready to pay the price to stay in this kind of assembly, so you will have to ask yourself if you are ready to pay the price. I would rather have us few than to be a large number of people without a standard.

 

We do believe in sending ministries, it is just that the standard has to be high. I will not put my hand publicly on you and commission you into ministry if you are not a faithful son in the house. Some people have demanded that I release them and when I check my spirit and ask God for permission, in most cases, He says no, He did not send them. In such situations, sometimes, I just pray for them but not publicly. If I will pray over you publicly, it must be because you are faithful son under the watchful eyes of our General Overseer, Jesus.

 

I remember that someone close to Daddy Oyegoke left and started his ministry; Daddy prayed for him but not publicly because he was not meant to leave. Before Pastor Thompson started Loveseal Church, he waited for years. It was as though Daddy Oyegoke had forgotten him. Even the day he was eventually prayed for, he was not expecting it; that is how it is done.

 

I believe in sendings but in a true apostolic order. I believe in both pioneering and extensive ministries. One of the things that is happening to this emerging kingdom order is that God is reducing unnecessary breakages. There is a pioneering grace, you must wait to get it before you start any church. God might put grace on you to pioneer a church that is not an extension of a former church. This is akin to what Pastor Thompson is doing. He was under Pastor Emeka who was serving under Daddy and they sensed that he had grace to begin a new pioneering work which was still the same work but with a different identity. God put it in his spirit but it was confirmed also; the leading of the Spirit is very detailed.

 

There was a time when New and Living Way Church (NLWC) sent one particular brother to pastor a branch of NLWC but he was angry and left because he said if he could be considered to pastor a branch of NLWC, why could he not have his own church. What he did not understand was that he should not even have considered having his own; it is a wrong attitude. He was thinking of having an empire, he did not understand that there are specificities and details in these things.

 

Most times, it is safe when you are under. Pastor Emeka often says that his ministry is an appendage to EGFM, that is wisdom. I believe that is what God called him uniquely to do and he has been faithful at it. May we all be found faithful. I believe in sending, and I know that this is an area where we often get attacked but it has to be done according to order. I do not believe in sending people anyhow. In the church today, we do all kinds of things and we do not even understand the ordinations of the New Testament. In fact, some believers select their fathers and they often select weak fathers who cannot instruct them.

 

I can never be bigger than Daddy Oyegoke no matter how well this church grows. Bishop Oyedepo is not bigger than Papa Hagin even though Winners is way bigger physically than Rhema; having a big ministry is not by the size.

 

No believer should compel a minister to lay hands on them, that is witchcraft. If you eventually get hands laid on you that way, nothing will go with you. When Daddy Oyegoke laid hands on me, I know something left from him to me. That is the kind of sending I want, I do not want to start any work with no power backing me up. Spiritual gifts can finish anytime so you have to go forth with more than that.

 

The pastoral office with bishops is the closest to the saints and it is the least discerned and easy for saints to despise. Naturally, it is easy not to regard someone you see every time but to like the one that comes once in a while. I remember a pastor friend who invited a female guest minister to his church. When she finished, many of the members of that church were so wowed that many of them went to meet that minister after the service and said they wanted to submit to her. The wife of the host pastor is a very anointed minister who had been working on the saints but because she was always with them, they despised her. That is how children behave. Naturally, children can like neighbours more than their parents. A pastor can be close to you and has all that you need but you will not see it nor appreciate it. Grace can be passing through him everyday, yet you are not seeing it. This is why we are teaching these things so that you can discern the pastoral grace and cleave well.

 

A local church under the authority of the pastor should also work with ministry gifts. There are ministry gifts we bring as the Lord permits to this local assembly and they bless us when they come. It is not any minister that can work with a church at a level. We cannot just bring anybody here because they are popular in the church, that does not mean they know the work we are doing here. Work in churches is at different levels, so, when we bring certain ministers here, all of us combined make up the five-fold.

 

You do not need any other thing outside the ones we perceive should be brought in a season. A minister may not know what we are building here, so he will just come and say things that will scatter the work. Pastors of local churches need to work with ministers that can discern the work in their assembly. Someone can be an apostle of milk but he cannot discern a meat or strong meat church; he cannot bless such works. When ministers that I work together with as a team in a larger context come here to preach, I do not need to balance their message. I am saying this because some of you have questions concerning this; we cannot bring any and everyone to this pulpit. I want us to appreciate the flow of grace the Lord has provided for us.

fields.blog_title: The Shepherd's Tent (Ethics Governing New Testament Church Life) Pt.2
fields.blog_body:
Interpretation of Tongues

Open to you this morning, open to you again this morning is that access you always enjoy. It is opened again to you so you can draw out things; for to spring out things, to draw out waters, to you, to draw out even to the people. I open to you that access that is in this house, that everyone in this house enjoys, everyone that stands to minister under Me in this house. I open that same door, I open that same access, I give you that same access again this morning to bless everyone in this house. There is a heavenly blessing that is due to come to you, I open the fountains, I open the heavens for dew to come down, to reach the people and for people to be blessed. I want to bless you again this morning. So, open your heart again this morning and receive My blessings, for the heavens are pregnant, the heavens are full, the clouds are full and are ready to pour down rain. I bring My rain to you, I open My blessings to you.

 

Message Begins

In this teaching, we proceed with what we started at the last teaching. There are ethics governing the New Testament church life as pertaining to Her relationship with the Shepherd. There are ethics and those ethics are not there for 'control sake', they were put there so that the flock or the sheep can draw blessings from the Shepherd. Jesus is the Chief Shepherd in the New Testament church, but we can see that Jesus puts men in place under His shepherdic oversight. We need to understand this because there are doctrines being peddled around that are against the order Jesus has put in place. For instance, some people say they are under Jesus and not under any man, they make statements such as: ‘I don’t call any man my father’. These thoughts are not accurate; in the New Testament church, pastors are positioned as overseers and epistles written to believers in the context of a church.

 

Jesus as the Chief Shepherd puts men in place and there is no way you can bypass those men to have access to Him (Jesus). I pray that this will become a common understanding in the Body of Christ. If you don’t have pastors over you, you can’t progress. There is no way you can contend with the forces fighting the churches in

 

this age without an oversight God has placed over you. If Satan is after your family and you don’t have pastors, you are in trouble because you cannot wage that war yourself; you don't know what it takes to fight spirits. Spirits can tear a family apart because they are not under covering or alignment. Fundamentally, angels are regimented and they understand order very well, including fallen angels; they know order and can see whether you are under or not. They know when you are outside alignment and they harness that premise to attack you. Fallen spirits try to dislodge many believers from alignment. To be in alignment means that when heaven looks at you from above, they see an order - our Lord Jesus is under the Father, the pastor is under the Lord, and you are under the pastor They have placed you under. If you are not under anyone who is under God, when you are traced and you are not found aligning, you are on your own.

 

Angelic spirits understand order; they know those that are under authority; under shepherds with our Lord Jesus as the Chief Shepherd.

 

1 Peter 5:1 KJV

  1. The elders which are among you I exhort, who am also an elder, and a witness of the sufferings of Christ, and also a

partaker of the glory that shall be revealed:

 

All of them were not elders, few were elders amongst them. Peter, who was writing to them, was also an elder, writing to elders. Before you can be an elder, you must be a witness of the sufferings of Christ. An elder is not what you become because you have been in church for long and the pastor likes you; you can be an elder like that for administrative purposes but not in line with what Peter was saying here.

 

1 Peter 5:2-3 KJV

  1. Feed the flock of God which is among you, taking the oversight thereof, not by constraint, but willingly; not for filthy

lucre, but of a ready mind;

  1. Neither as being lords over God's heritage, but being ensamples to the flock.

 

The primary assignment of true shepherds is to feed and oversee the flock; no one should do it for gain because the people, the flock are actually God's heritage. This is why a shepherd should be an example to the flock.

 

1 Peter 5:4 KJV

  1. And when the chief Shepherd shall appear, ye shall receive a crown of glory that fadeth not away.

 

If He is the Chief Shepherd, then it means there are others under Him. Gabriel called Michael the Chief Prince which means that there are other princes under him. The Lord Jesus is called the Chief Shepherd, it means there are shepherds under Him and He will reward those that are shepherding under Him. They are working under Him, but He is the Chief under the Father. He comes to check what they are doing, and strengthen their work from time to time. That is why as a flock, you do not have the right to correct your pastor because you are not the Chief over him, Jesus is the Chief over him. You don't have the right to speak against a man that Jesus puts in place. For instance, in medical line, as a patient, if you are being treated by a doctor and while he is administering your treatment, the chief consultant comes in, you can seek to speak with him directly. However, when you are done speaking, he will turn to the resident doctor to hear what he has to say and it is what he says that determines what he will use; not your suggestion because the doctor has been trained for years. Jesus has trained and raised men whom he has put in place as shepherds, yours is to make sure that you are in alignment to receive from them.

 

In a local assembly, we are used to the word ‘pastor’ which is also correct but the word pastor and shepherd have the same meaning in Greek.

 

Shepherds are very key to the salvation plan. Removing the pastoral ministry from the Body will make it very difficult for salvation to reach the saints; that ministry is highly needed for salvation. The pastoral ministry is highly needed, other ministries in the Body can have temporal contact with the saints but the pastor is meant to stay with the flock. A prophet can come to an assembly, minister to saints and leave afterwards, the same with an apostle but a pastor stays with the saints. He lives with the saints to make sure that what is being communicated to them is being carried out. They have a more detailed work, that is why they have so much attack from the saints they are pastoring than other ministries in the Body. A flock can prefer a ministry gift that visits than the pastor over him because of familiarity but as we grow up, we will understand that it is part of being childish or immature to do that. Some believers go as far as collecting the number of an itinerant minister and open up their lives to such a minister rather than their pastor. It is against New Testament ethics; even when you receive prayers and impartation from such mediums without the permission of your pastor, they will not work.

 

 

Ephesians 4:7-8 KJV

    1. But unto every one of us is given grace according to the measure of the gift of Christ.

    2. Wherefore he saith, When he ascended up on high, he led captivity captive, and gave gifts unto men.

 

These gifts are not referring to gift cards, they are men. They are also not the gifts of the spirit but they are men given as gifts. If a saint is not maximizing Jesus' gift, he will not profit in his walk with God. He has given you the gift and it is your duty to receive it.

 

Acts 19:2 KJV

  1. He said unto them, Have ye received the Holy Ghost since ye believed? And they said unto him, We have not so much as heard

whether there be any Holy Ghost.

 

It is possible for something to be given but you have not received it. I believe every saint that got born again already has a pastor; there is someone Jesus has assigned to pastor him. Many believers may never meet their person God has set over them until they go to heaven. The Holy Ghost cannot get you born again and just leave you, He sets you in the Body and has assigned that you will be pastored but many people do not get to meet their pastors till they die. Who would give birth to a child and just leave them on the road? No sane person would do that, how much more the Holy Ghost? The Holy Ghost has plans of where you should be but some believers are rebels and will not allow the Holy Ghost to lead them to where they should be. Some, out of their own lusts and idols fall into the hands of hirelings.

 

I have often wondered why people end up with hirelings but I understood when I read the story of a woman and it answered the question in my heart. The woman, while she was an unbeliever, had visited a church and when an altar call was made, she stepped out and got born again but as she sat back at her seat and the pastor continued teaching, the Holy Spirit told her that what that pastor was preaching was false. Jesus knows that there are hirelings in the Body, do you think He will get you born again and lead you to hirelings? For every believer that falls into the hands of hirelings, they have disobeyed the Holy Ghost. The Holy Ghost told that lady that even though that pastor led her to Christ, he was teaching a false doctrine. Most times, we play with nudges and witnesses in our hearts. Many who came to this local assembly for instance have a witness in their heart that this message is true.

 

 

So also, you should be able to know when something is false. Many fall prey because they do not pay attention to that prompting. The first time I heard of a man who claimed to be a prophet in Nigeria (he is late now), I was born again but I was not so serious then. As I listened to him on television, I knew something was not right with that man. Then I wondered what had come over those seated in the church listening to him. If they are believers, they have lost touch with the nudgings of the Spirit in them, it is even possible that most of them are not born again; if you are born again, you would have a witness in your heart.

 

Ephesians 4:8-11 KJV

    1. Wherefore he saith, When he ascended up on high, he led captivity captive, and gave gifts unto men.

    2. (Now that he ascended, what is it but that he also descended first into the lower parts of the earth?

    3. He that descended is the same also that ascended up far above all heavens, that he might fill all things.)

    4. And he gave some, apostles; and some, prophets; and some, evangelists; and some, pastors and teachers;

 

These are the gifts. Apostles don't stay in the local assembly ministering to the saints as a pastor will do. This is the standard of the New Testament apostle. If someone claims that he is a New Testament apostle, just check them and compare them with Apostle Paul; there are standards in scriptures. Paul was a New Testament apostle who was always going around establishing churches and breaking new grounds. Apostles, evangelists and those with teaching ministries in the Body move around but pastors stay with the flock. Every work that these ministry gifts are doing are supposed to be nurtured by pastors and if the pastoral team is not thorough, the work will be wasted because there will be no one making sure that the whole light is becoming a lifestyle. If you want to know who a saint really is, ask the pastor, they know the saints well more than every other ministry gift.

 

Ephesians 4:12 KJV

    1. For the perfecting of the saints, for the work of the ministry, for the edifying of the body of Christ:

 

Pastors are given for saints to be perfected, they are given so that the light coming to the Body through other ministry gifts can sit well; the pastor makes sure that those things are well obeyed for the perfecting of the saints. They watch to make sure that

 

the saints are growing up properly. True pastors want the saints to be perfected and ensure that they are going through processes to make them perfect.

 

Colossians 1:27-28 KJV

  1. To whom God would make known what is the riches of the glory of this mystery among the Gentiles; which is Christ in you,

the hope of glory:

  1. Whom we preach, warning every man, and teaching every man in all wisdom; that we may present every man perfect in

Christ Jesus:

 

Pastors warn as they preach and teach, so that they will be able to present every man perfected. Perfection is the goal of the pastoral ministry and the saints must be beaten to shape to be perfected.

 

2 Timothy 3:15-16 KJV

  1. And that from a child thou hast known the holy scriptures, which are able to make thee wise unto salvation through faith

which is in Christ Jesus.

  1. All scripture is given by inspiration of God, and is profitable for doctrine, for reproof, for correction, for instruction in

righteousness:

 

This scripture is written to a pastor about how he should carry out his assignment and duty. Pastors reprove, it is part of their job description, they should reprove when necessary. They can reprove you outside the pulpit or on the pulpit. They can reprove you by the teaching of the word or call you into their office to reprove you. The saints will not come into the place where they are beaten to shape. If these things are not handled, the saints will be lopsided; these are all part of the pastoral ministry.

 

Your pastor can call you and tell you what you should be doing, they can instruct you, that is their duty. While looking at this teaching I got to know that Satan has done a terrible work in the Body. When believers have been made smart, they are no longer sheep, they are no longer innocent. Satan knows that if you are not innocent and sheepish, there is no way the pastoral ministry can bless you. The pastor is a shepherd, he can only bless you when you are a sheep. You have to be sheepish, if you are not sheepish, you will be eluded.

 

The heads of most believers have become bigger than their hearts, so they find it difficult to trust oversights. We find it difficult to believe and be led because we have become too smart and our smartness is taking us away from God. We are no longer innocent and it has affected our attitude. May the Lord help us in Jesus' name. The kinds of saints that are very common in the Body right now are beginning to morph into a kind of church that Jesus has not set. Saints are determining the church they want, the kind of pastor they want, how the church will look like; churches are even being designed to appeal to the smart minds of the saints. With that which the devil is communicating, you will not be able to partake of the blessing of the New Testament.

 

2 Timothy 3:17 KJV

  1. That the man of God may be perfect, throughly furnished unto all good works.

 

This kind of man of God being referred to here should not just be the preacher, he should also be a man of God. What makes a man of God is the furnishing of his soul, all the chambers of his soul are decked with knowledge. Your soul is furnished for God to dwell, it means God finds it attractive for dwelling. A man of God is a man that God can dwell in. We can see perfection here again like the one in Ephesians chapter 4, so it means perfection cannot come to pass without reprove, correction, and instruction in righteousness.

 

2 Timothy 4:1-2 KJV

    1. I charge thee therefore before God, and the Lord Jesus Christ, who shall judge the quick and the dead at his appearing

and his kingdom;

    1. Preach the word; be instant in season, out of season; reprove, rebuke, exhort with all longsuffering and doctrine.

 

Pastors are preachers and teachers of doctrine. There are all kinds of things redefining who a pastor is. Some people go to school to study guidance and counseling and they call themselves pastors. Some pastors are like that, they speak nicely but that does not make them genuine pastors. Pastors handle doctrine, they labour in word and doctrine, that is why they should be given double honour. Whenever you see the pastoral ministry, teaching is always accompanied. Would they go weary? No, they will not because it is part of their job description, they have to be instant to teach.

 

Bishops are those that function under the pastors of local assemblies, they are not those that have big churches. They serve under senior pastors.

 

 

      1. Timothy 3:1-2 KJV

  2. This is a true saying, If a man desire the office of a bishop, he desireth a good work.

  3. A bishop then must be blameless, the husband of one wife, vigilant, sober, of good behaviour, given to hospitality, apt to

teach;

 

It is a good work to serve under a senior pastor. These ones who play this role are known as bishops.

 

1 Timothy 3:3-6 KJV

  1. Not given to wine, no striker, not greedy of filthy lucre; but patient, not a brawler, not covetous;

  2. One that ruleth well his own house, having his children in subjection with all gravity;

  3. (For if a man know not how to rule his own house, how shall he take care of the church of God?)

  4. Not a novice, lest being lifted up with pride he fall into the condemnation of the devil.

 

They were functioning under Timothy as the senior pastor of the Ephesian church. Timothy was not a bishop, he was a pastor and he ordained the bishops so that they function under him. Paul also told Titus to ordain bishops so he could be relieved. Pastors need bishops to relieve them of burdens so that they can also focus on doctrine and other weightier matters. We can also see something similar in the Old Testament where the spirit upon Moses was put upon the seventy, those were bishops under Moses.

 

In your exhortation as a pastor, it has to be done with long suffering. It is possible you teach one message ten times so that the saints can get it. Pastors have to endure and keep repeating the same thing.

 

      1. Timothy 4:2-4 KJV

    2. Preach the word; be instant in season, out of season; reprove, rebuke, exhort with all longsuffering and doctrine.

    3. For the time will come when they will not endure sound doctrine; but after their own lusts shall they heap to themselves

teachers, having itching ears;

 

    1. And they shall turn away their ears from the truth, and shall be turned unto fables.

 

Pastors should hold sound doctrine. Pastors are supposed to reprove and correct. We saw last week that one of the major works of a pastor is to feed the flock and all these things are part of the feeding process. Correction and reprove flows out of teaching, that does not mean that they correct only on the pulpit, when they see that your life is not in line with what they are teaching, they can single you out for correction.

 

Let us consider what the attitudes of the sheep should be. Jesus has given pastors to feed and tend the flock, to nourish the sheep but you must be a sheep for those things to be a blessing to you. If you take another posture, it becomes difficult. We don't become sheep in one day but we must constantly be striving to come to a place where we are acquiring the attitude of a sheep so that we can access pastoral grace.

 

The shepherd can only deploy his shepherdic role to sheep not to dogs, for dogs do not have the attribute to get the blessing from shepherds. Sheep must be in folds. A fold is an enclosure for sheep; it is enclosed and you cannot just get access into it. If you enter through the window, you are a robber. In looking at the shepherd’s tent, it has one door and if you don't have access to the door and you come in through the window, you are a thief and a robber who is accessing the sheep wrongly without going through the Lord who owns them.

 

John 10:1-2 KJV

      1. Verily, verily, I say unto you, He that entereth not by the door into the sheepfold, but climbeth up some other way, the

same is a thief and a robber.

      1. But he that entereth in by the door is the shepherd of the sheep.

 

There is a right access to the sheep and that access is the door; Jesus must give you the right access to the sheepfold. A fold is an enclosure for the sheep. People who are into sheep grazing do not just scatter them anyhow, there is always a door and a fence erected. In this local church, there is a fence and a door in the spirit and the Lord Jesus Christ is the door. Some people like pastoring, they just love to have control over saints but those that are true shepherds don't even desire it. Apostle Paul said one can desire to be a Bishop but they must possess the qualities that he mentioned and the senior pastor will be the one to appoint them. You cannot have a

 

calling to the sheep in a fold without the senior shepherd knowing about it, you are a thief and a robber. As a sheep, you should know when a thief is trying to access you by telling you certain things and instructing you not to tell your pastor.

 

If you are nursing some things in your mind without the knowledge of your pastors and you know in your spirit that those things are wrong, you are opening yourself to thieves and robbers and if you are not careful, it can rob you of life, and the things God has deposited in your soul. You must be careful of thieves and robbers, they are always around sheep folds. There is a shepherd attached to a fold, it is always one shepherd to a fold; the fold in this context signifies local assemblies. Daddy and mummy are shepherds in this house while the associate pastors are bishops under them helping them to do the work, that is the way God set it. Another word for fold is families, local assemblies are families.

 

Psalms 68:6 KJV

(6) God setteth the solitary in families: he bringeth out those which are bound with chains: but the rebellious dwell in a dry

land.

 

They want to bring a sheep into a fold. The rebellious are people who refuse this kind of leading to come into a fold, so they will not have access to refreshment, nourishment and growth, they will be stagnant in their growth. Have you seen some believers who, after 15 years of being a Christain, have become dry and stagnant. God wants to move sheep into folds because when sheep are in folds, His work over them will be made easier. God can easily access a sheep in a fold with meals for their growth than sheep outside the fold. God's desire is that sheep will be in folds, not that they should be scattered everywhere. He wants to gather the sheep but Satan wants to scatter them. God wants to gather sheep and put a shepherd over them.

 

In the book of Revelation, the angels of the churches are the shepherds of those churches to take those letters, lights, instructions, and messages to them in their fold. If you are not in a fold in the New Testament church, it will be difficult for God to reach you, that’s the reason we are all here in this local assembly. When you are in the fold, accountability and accessibility is easier; feeding and nourishment will not be difficult and oversight will become easy as well.

 

Acts 2:42-44 KJV

  1. And they continued stedfastly in the apostles' doctrine and fellowship, and in breaking of bread, and in prayers.

  2. And fear came upon every soul: and many wonders and signs were done by the apostles.

  3. And all that believed were together, and had all things common;

 

In the local assembly, the gathering will first of all be bodily before it becomes soulical. We first gather bodily before we gather inwardly, we cannot gather inwardly without bodily gathering.

 

Hebrews 10:25 KJV

  1. Not forsaking the assembling of ourselves together, as the manner of some is; but exhorting one another: and so much the

more, as ye see the day approaching.

 

This is a physical gathering. Don't be part of those “some” that forsake the assembly, it is not a good attitude.

 

Hebrews 10:26 KJV

  1. For if we sin wilfully after that we have received the knowledge of the truth, there remaineth no more sacrifice for

sins,

 

If you are forsaking the gathering of the brethren, this kind of sin is not far from your doorstep. If you are together with the brethren, it will be difficult to commit this sin.

 

Hebrews 3:13 KJV

  1. But exhort one another daily, while it is called To day; lest any of you be hardened through the deceitfulness of sin.

 

If you are escaping the exhortation that comes by gathering, hardness of heart is not far from you. In the gospel, there is what is called deceitfulness of sin and deceitfulness of riches. That is, you want to make money and you think that the church does not want you to make money which causes you to draw back and forsake the assembly of the saints. We don’t gather in the spirit, we are quickened in our spirits to gather physically. The Lord will not be wasting resources to do all He does to make us gather if it is not important; His supplied facilities are to enhance the gathering of the saints.

 

    1. And all that believed were together, and had all things common;

 

Gathering together is very important, and I appeal to you that you do all to be gathered with the saints. Don't have an attitude that is always distant, don’t engage yourself in activities that excuse you from the gathering of the saints. If it is a job, begin to plan to get another one. Nothing should affect your gathering, it is a major commandment all believers should strive to keep.

 

Acts 2:45-47 KJV

    1. And sold their possessions and goods, and parted them to all men, as every man had need.

    2. And they, continuing daily with one accord in the temple, and breaking bread from house to house, did eat their meat with

gladness and singleness of heart,

    1. Praising God, and having favour with all the people. And the Lord added to the church daily such as should be saved.

 

The Lord added, He did not allow people to stay in their houses. This should happen to every quickened believer, you must experience addition physically to a fold with a pastor as an oversight. There is a school of thought that says that all believers are brethren and are all the same, it does not work that way and is not a mindset in alignment with scriptures. In the early church where believers were gathering, Peter was the head and overseer there. When the Bible said that they sold their possession and put it at the apostle’s feet, it meant Peter’s feet, not all the apostles. The Bible often says: "Peter and the eleven" (cf. Acts 2:14, Matthew 10:2), which means Peter was the head. That means Jesus taught them well as their overseer. Even in an instance where Peter and John are mentioned, Peter is the one who always speaks. It was never recorded that John asked Peter to allow him to add to what Peter has spoken. Whatever Peter spoke was okay for the apostles because it was Peter that the Lord told to feed His sheep.

 

Acts 3:4-5 KJV

  1. And Peter, fastening his eyes upon him with John, said, Look on us.

  2. And he gave heed unto them, expecting to receive something of them.

 

(14) But Peter, standing up with the eleven, lifted up his voice, and said unto them, Ye men of Judaea, and all ye that dwell at Jerusalem, be this known unto you, and hearken to my words:

 

So, even amongst the leadership of the early church (the twelve), Peter was the head. So when people say all believers are the same, they are deceiving themselves. Those disorderly thoughts are woven by evil spirits for people not to get blessed in a local assembly. Such a church will never prosper and heaven will not stamp it because it is not in order. Anything that is flowing according to order will keep going stronger and stronger. For instance, the house of David kept growing stronger while the house of Saul kept growing weaker. It was not that the house of David was fighting against the house of Saul, David was not fighting the house of Saul physically but because it was not in alignment with the Lord, it grew weaker. You don’t need to fight anything false, all you need is to do the right thing and the false will go away by default; anything that will endure is that which is in alignment with God’s will.

 

1 John 2:17 KJV

(17) And the world passeth away, and the lust thereof: but he that doeth the will of God abideth for ever.

 

The world will pass away and anything that is not in line with the will is the world which will pass away. Anything attached to the will, that is obeying the will, any institution following God’s will, will remain but anything that departs from God’s will will begin to die.

 

 

Interpretation of Tongues

I believe the Lord is giving us wisdom.

 

Message Continues

If the Lord tells you to stay under an assembly and submit to a pastor, and you think you have a grace higher than that place, if you dissociate from that assembly, the grace God gave you will wane; you will watch it die a natural death. It will depreciate until you become a shadow of yourself; it will not appreciate and will not grow. Anytime you see people blossoming in the spirit, it is because they are connected to the place God has placed them. It is not by prayers only, just being connected with the right posture makes you blossom in the Spirit. It is like a tree that has many

 

branches and draws nutrients from the stem. If you cut off a branch, that branch will die. In the same way, if you cut off yourself, you will die and wither away. Satan is a shadow of himself, he is passing away; he is dying because he disconnected from the source of life. When you know where you ought to submit, please don’t dissociate from them, remain connected.

 

The Lord will give us wisdom to stay where God has put us. Do not think that you are less there. Maybe you are doing something in church and Satan is telling you that you are doing something low, do not believe him. Satan can send men to you who will encourage you to go start your work and that the place you are wasting your time by going to that place. I can tell you that as long as you go away, that is where you will waste away and will end like the prodigal son. That is when you will find yourself doing something that you can't imagine. We must be very wise in this season, I perceive Satan wants to cut many off, be wise! Don't allow Satan to cut you off the inheritance. You have a stake here. This church is not Pastor Dimeji’s church. This is Jesus’ church.

 

You have a stake here, you have an inheritance in this local assembly. If you don't take your inheritance here, you will lose your place. Those that inherit God are those that inherit their place, everyone that God connects to a church has a place in that church, you know what they call the church, ecclesia, it means we all have to sit like a senate meeting representing a constituency, don't let another take your seat. The Lord has a place for you here, if not, He won’t bring you here.

 

Interpretation of Tongues

I hear the Lord say the enemy is around you, he is very very around, very present with you, sowing seeds, seeds even of offense, seeds of hurt, seeds of offense, many are already being offended, it is the enemy that is sowing a seed in your heart, do not be offended for as you are offended you will go out, do not be offended it is not my seed, it is a wrong seed, don't conceive it within you, don’t allow it to bring forth, for it will bring forth death to kill you. Anything you do because of that seed will bring death to you, it will sniff life out of you, don't allow that seed of offense at all. Don't allow it, don’t hear it, reject it, for many who have gone in time past left in the guise of offense. I don't want you to go in the line of offense, that is the scheme of Satan and his wile to take many out, be wise for you to resist the seed of offence, be wise for you to resist the wisdom of Satan, you will stand and grow where I have placed you and you will find your place even your place in heaven, your name will not only be written on earth, it will be written in heaven.

 

 

\2. Troubled, troubled hearts, for they are hearts being troubled, hearts being troubled, the adversary troubling your heart from coming into peace, for from trouble heart you will go out for a heart under the shepherd should be still, only a still heart can be gathered to enter. For there is a door upon you in this season for many to enter. For when you are troubled in your heart, you will not see the door lest you enter. I want you to come to peace, agree with what you are being taught, agree with my dealings and leadings over you, agree and don't be troubled in your heart, that which is troubling you let it go and come to My peace, it is in peace that you can profit with what I am teaching you, some people are still troubled, their hearts are troubled. You are troubled because of your fears, don't be troubled for your fears, cast these fears away, as you stay you will see that it is not really the fear, it was Satan masquerading many things not wanting you to stay in your lot, many have gone in their fear and that which they feared was not given to them. I want you to stay and learn and overcome your fears. I am doing a work of gathering upon the mountains. I want to gather you upon the mountain. I want to gather you as a house into the height, I want to plant you upon the mountain, come up into the mountain for your inheritance and I will plant you upon the mountain of your inheritance, don't sit, don’t stay in troubled waters, stay and you will be planted, you will see yourself planted and you will find yourself established in the days to come.

 

Message Continues

 

Acts 2:47 KJV

  1. Praising God, and having favour with all the people. And the Lord added to the church daily such as should be saved.

 

If you are not added, you will not be saved. Where God wants to do something serious, is where people are gathered. It is the people that He has gathered that he will commit serious things into their hands. Jesus never committed things serious to the multitude because they could not gather them, it was the twelve that He could gather that He committed things to.

 

Philippians 2:1-2 KJV

    1. If there be therefore any consolation in Christ, if any comfort of love, if any fellowship of the Spirit, if any bowels and

mercies,

    1. Fulfil ye my joy, that ye be likeminded, having the same love, being of one accord, of one mind.

 

 

If you have not been gathered bodily, they can't gather your mind. We can't be scattered all over in the Body and have the mind of Christ. We need to gather around doctrine that shapes the mind of Christ to have the mind of Christ. This is necessary to bring down something that you can't on your own access. Daddy has said that the epistles were not written to individuals, they were written to churches. Those things that the Lord is sending to local assembly meetings, they won't send it to your house, no matter how strong your Bible study is, you can't access it, you can only have access to it in the midst of the brethren. We must place a premium on our physical gathering.

 

There are some kinds of attitudes that are not here that I want to also talk about which do not allow people to receive from pastors.

 

Pastors are friendly, but they are not your friends. When you begin to see your pastors as friends you will have problems. If you complete all your plans and you come to inform him as a friend, you will not come into blessing. That is why our Lord Jesus has found it difficult to lead friends to come under their friends as pastors because they are unable to follow with an open heart. But it should not be because you should have a pastor, and you are not the one to choose your pastor for yourself, so if the Lord says let your friend pastor you, there is something in it that you are not seeing. If you dislocate yourself and put yourself in some other places, you will not partake of the grace of the pastoral ministry even though you are a Christian. Christians that have not been pastored at all will trouble the church and their family; unpastored saints cannot raise children. As far as Jesus is concerned, He has given you a pastor He knows will help you grow up and will not give you another one because you refused the one He gave you; Jesus is tough. There are people that the Lord has told, about ten years ago, to move to a higher level but failed to respond; they will not grow. Do not allow age factors to stop you from enjoying pastoral ministry. Theologians say that Peter was older than Jesus and Jesus called him Satan and he was not offended. John the baptist really prepared the way, he prepared them. What is that thing that will stop you from accessing pastoral blessing? If you allow it, you will notice that you have cheated yourself when you cross to the other side, it is not even about the pastor. MayGod help us to be better saints that will not give our pastor's problem.

 

 

Closing Exhortation Pst. Dimeji Elugabdebo

 

This teaching is being taught that we might understand what the relationship between the pastor and the flock should be like. I have taught this particular burden twice in the history of this church, it is not a message you teach once. Kenneth Hagin said there are messages he taught nineteen times, it is because of the nature of the flock. That you heard a message does not mean that you have fully heard it. I taught ‘He gave pastors’ two years ago, but even though it is being taught again, it is going to be different. There are a lot of deceptions and misguided teachings circulating in the body, that if you don't have a strong pastoral base, you will be moved.

 

Thank you for saying that the sheepfold is enclosed, no wise shepherd will allow the sheep to just be roaming as they like. When you see sheep feeding, they are being protected, they have overseers, they have those that God has anointed to oversee them. I was telling my wife yesterday that one of the blessings I enjoyed growing up was that I had strong pastors while growing up, and that will affect the texture of how your ministry will be.

 

If you planned using the City Gate Church as IT for ministry I will disappoint you, you can't even survive it. If you enter a true new testament church it will be very clear if you have a calling. Many who thought they have calling never really had. Because you are a pastor in fellowship does not mean you are a pastor, that is why I don't call them pastor. When we were in school, our fellowship president, we used to call them ‘brother’. All these people that are called apostles today just finished school five years ago, six years ago. If you finish school as a pastor, join a church, carry speaker, prove your ministry.

 

It is these boys that choose their spiritual fathers themselves, and the father they pick also were not also well pastored, they are also looking for sons, so many confusion, to get yourself in that is to get yourself in trouble.

 

A true new testament church is actually a blessing, your primary blessing is attached there, God does not design it that you will be receiving from the internet. I am not against receiving itinerary ministries. EGFM is an itinerary ministry, God’s servant is my spiritual servant and he is called to the larger body of Christ. Like an apostle is called to the larger body of Christ, pastors are sent to their local church. When saints are quickened in their spirit, they are sent to their local churches; pastors also connect ministries in the body that they work with to bless the saints. Don’t just feed from everywhere, if you trust me as a Pastor let me know who you are listening to. Some of these men you can't trace their emergence, and you are opening yourself to

 

such men you are not wise, can you do that to your children? Can you feed them with Bukka food, morning, afternoon and night? Part of parenting is to know what your children need including their feeding. We have itinerary ministries that we work with, you know them, we bring them here every year, you can listen to them because theory is a consistent there is a consistent emphasis of the spirit that we are working with. If you are going to feed from a ministry through their books or tapes, let us know them. There are three levels of feeding: (1) your local church (2) itinerary ministries in the Body of Christ that are approved and tested to be pure. Don’t open your soul to just anyone, there are lots of hirelings in the church. I am saying this with a very sorrowful heart, how I wish it was not like that, but Satan is doing his work, do not fall prey to such ministries. (3) your own personal bible study.

 

When it comes to feeding it is very important.

 

You must know how to connect with your pastor and receive grace from them. Your pastors are friendly but they are not your friend. If someone is your friend, he does not have to be your pastor, but if the Lord has chosen him to be your pastor, submit to them.

 

What the Lord does is that he provides spiritual covering for pastors, and that covering is attached to feeding.

 

Isaiah 4:5 KJV

(5) And the LORD will create upon every dwelling place of mount Zion, and upon her assemblies, a cloud and smoke by day, and the shining of a flaming fire by night: for upon all the glory shall be

a defence.

 

The Lord puts covering on the flock upon the lead shepherd as cloud and pillars wjich is an extension of providing sound doctrine for the people. No one knows the flock more than the shepherd that has oversight, even itinerary ministers have authority over the flock. If an itinerary minister gives you a prophecy, your pastor needs to scrutinize it and he is likely going to know. The pastor is a standing prophet, he may not be a prophet but he has prophetic dealings in his life else he cannot pastor flock.

 

This church has gone through stages. I know of one minister that used to come then.

There was a particular sister that kept meeting pastor, because she thinks my grace was shutting her down, so she went to be submitting to him. Of course she is not here

 

anymore, you cannot last in a local church that way. I believe primarily God sent her here, but like you said people enter into lesser purposes, she couldn’t stay, she could not cope with the training, she could not discern the assembly, she taught our own is just perfection and perfection. Discernment is key, if you don’t discern well, you won’t maximize some grace. I even prefer people that leave physically, it makes you have a sense of responsibility that you need to get to somewhere else, but when you are in the place and you have disconnected, you can be like that for twenty years. I used to tell my wife that there is a brother that has been in a church for years and has not connected, of course he gets other benefits from the church like business connection but the main reason he was sent there, he is not benefiting from it, and the pastor of that church is one of the best teachers I know in the body today.

 

All the five fold ministry gifts are shepherdic, a prophet is shepherdic, even though he is not a pastor, he will not take you out of the church, many people called prophets are really not prophets, they have anointings that have been perverted by spirits, the prophetic is one of the most volatile gifts in the body, and are most prone to deception. You will hardly hear of false pastors, you can see an hireling but in the scriptures false prophets stand out. False prophets begin it, while false teachers establish what they start. We need to teach the purity of prophetic ministry. All of them are shepherdic not all will have a pastoral calling to lead a local church.

 

Because you are traveling does not make you an apostle. Some people don't move so much but they are apostles. What makes you an apostle is by calling and by office, it is not by traveling. You can be a traveling evangelist or teacher but that does not call you into the office of an apostle. There are apostles that don’t travel so much. History did not tell us that John traveled so much, but he was an apostle, traveling is not the measurement. Some people turn to apostles overnight because they are moving from place to place, but they don’t have apostolic things following them.

 

An apostle should be accountable to a pastor. There is no such thing as an apostle overseeing everybody that does not have a pastor. Paul had a base, he had guys that could speak to his life also. There is a system of government in the church that must be recovered,

 

Don't be semi-planted in a local church, be fully planted. Be careful of those semi-planted, don't be close to those that are semi-planted, stay away from them, I am saying it on the pulpit now. Someone can be in the church and is planning to go and open his own church, he knows what he wants to do already. The person catches

 

you as a potential church member. If God would send Him to pastor you, it is not in that church. God is not an author of confusion.

 

If I hear about any break away school, I don't take my children into such school because it is a rebel school. Let them have everything, I won’t send my children there. Do you know that the school you send your children to matters? It is possible that spirits are in the school, some teachers have caused heartache for some school owners, overnight they take students aways from the school, overnight students are gone. Same with church also, half of the church can be taken by sowing seeds.

 

Don't be semi-planted, decide; don't be 50% in: be 100%! It is either you are not in or you are in. If you see some people in and out don’t be close to them. Most of them have issues in their life, some people will never submit to church because of terrible things Satan has done in them, they will go to heaven like that, some of them will be pastored in the world to come whether they like it or not because the things that have shaped them wrongly will be taken away, it is a major veil. I heard a story of someone that struggled with church, he moved from church to church, currently his life is messed up.

 

God has a wisdom, you are a sheep, that is how God made us, and sheep are designed to flock together, anything outside that is anti our nature in the New Testament.
